body_html: Thank you SiddGururani, copying the cuDNN dll, lib, and header to the CUDA folder's respective subfolders worked for me as well. I have Cuda 8.0 and cuDNN 5.1, and (native) pip install tensorflow-gpu had claimed success, but I was still having this problem.
body_text: Thank you SiddGururani, copying the cuDNN dll, lib, and header to the CUDA folder's respective subfolders worked for me as well. I have Cuda 8.0 and cuDNN 5.1, and (native) pip install tensorflow-gpu had claimed success, but I was still having this problem.
body: Thank you SiddGururani, copying the cuDNN dll, lib, and header to the CUDA folder's respective subfolders worked for me as well. I have Cuda 8.0 and cuDNN 5.1, and (native) pip install tensorflow-gpu had claimed success, but I was still having this problem.
